pullRequest.body:
The main results are:

- `RootPairing.Base.cartanMatrix_le_zero_of_ne` (off-diagonal entries of Cartan matrices are non-positive)
- `RootPairing.Base.root_sub_root_mem_of_mem_of_mem` (lemma 2.5 from Geck 2017)

---

The changes to the files `FaaDiBruno.lean` and `Bochner.lean` are a legacy of an attempt to add `simp` to the lemma [Set.insert_subset_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Insert.html#Set.insert_subset_iff) which I was originally intending to include with these changes.

In the end I decided such a change would have to happen separately but these two changes are minor proof improvements which I propose to keep.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [d7e821f8b3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22213/commits/d7e821f8b394fa628456060687f65bea162496a8)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.CartanMatrix | 1413 | 1419 | +6 (+0.42%) |
| Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.Finite.Lemmas | 1417 | 1418 | +1 (+0.07%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.Finite.Lemmas`|1|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.CartanMatrix`|6|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Fintype.mem_span_image_iff_exists_fun`
`+ LinearIndependent.restrict_scalars'`
`+ cartanMatrix_apply_same`
`+ cartanMatrix_le_zero_of_ne`
`+ mem_span_image_iff_exists_fun`
`+ pairingIn_le_zero_of_ne`
`+ pairingIn_zero_iff`
`+ pos_or_neg_of_sum_smul_root_mem`
`+ root_add_root_mem_of_mem_of_mem`
`+ root_sub_root_mem_of_mem_of_mem`
`+ sub_nmem_range_coroot`
`+ sub_nmem_range_root`
`+ zero_lt_pairingIn_iff'`
`- LinearIndependent.restrict_scalars_algebras`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Hmm, I feel like the forward direction is what will be used most. But ideally also in cases where `s` isn't necessarily finite. So could you please modify the statement so that it says there is a `t : Finset \a` with `t \subset s` such that yaddayadda?

OK I've added a version with the sort of statement I think you had in mind (and which does not assume finiteness). I have retained what I had though: I claim that we will benefit from having both. As evidence I highlight that my use case is much more convenient with the original version.
(I do however agree it is worth having the version you describe.)

pullRequest.title: feat: more structural lemmas about root pairings

source.title: Implement Lusztig / Geck's construction of semisimple Lie algebras
